We love it when our alumni give back!
Shane Edward '13 wanted to find a way to help as schools undertake the task of opening doors to students. Shane enjoyed his time at Perrysburg and wanted to give back to the school community. He has donated 17,000 disposable masks to the district and has included a written note on each box providing encouragement and support. These will be distributed for use in classrooms, on buses, and school facilities throughout the district. Perrysburg Schools are grateful for this gift that will help ensure students and staff have access to clean masks as necessary! Shane dropped by Perrysburg Schools today to present the masks to Assistant Superintendent, Brook Price.
Thanks Shane for demonstrating what we mean when we say #onceajacketalwaysajacket.

This nicely done piece would look great in a frame or be a great gift. All proceeds will go to Parents Helping Students/Staff and will help our endeavors at Perrysburg High school to serve our staff and students. Prints will sell for $50.00 each and will be for sale as long as we have prints available. If interested, Please contact us via Facebook messenger or via our email at parentshelpingstudents@gmail.com

Thank you for your support

Islamic Food Bank of Toledo Pantry at Perrysburg Heights Community Association
12282 Jefferson St, Perrysburg OH 43551

Food Pantry Hours:
Open Monday, Wednesday and Friday
11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

Pull up to the center in your vehicle and food bags will be handed to you curbside. Please do not exit your car. Food supplies for multiple days will be provided. If you are showing signs of illness, stay home and call the center at 419-874-4529 for alternative arrangements.

What is available at the food pantry?
● Single-serve meals, snacks, breakfast items, brown bag lunch items, dinner ingredients, groceries, etc.

What do families need to bring?
● There is no sign-in required
● There are no eligibility requirements
● If you have a green food bag, bring it with you to assist in taking food home.

This free service has been established to support the hunger needs of families in our community.

Kathleen Schnerer, Perrysburg Schools Orchestra Director, has been awarded the 2019-2020 Ohio String Teachers Association (OSTA) New Teacher of the Year Award!
This honor is awarded to one teacher per year who is in their first to fifth year of teaching.

Her colleague, Patrick Barrett, former Orchestra Director, Perrysburg Junior High and Hull Prairie Intermediate, nominated her.

"It is a joy to teach alongside Kathleen,” shared her colleague, Betsy Cranston, Orchestra Director, Perrysburg Junior High and Hull Prairie Intermediate. “She has such a passion for teaching strings and is able to make even the most mundane technique practice an exciting adventure. Her students adore her and she cares deeply for not only their musical growth but also their development as people. To see this combination of skillful pedagogy and a contagious love of music in such a young teacher is truly inspiring!"

Tony Chen in Perrysburg High School’s Select Strings program was accepted to participate in the National Association for Music Education All-National Honors Ensemble!

Earlier this fall, Tony joined the “best of the best” musicians in Orlando, Florida. The All-National Honor Ensembles consist of a concert band, symphony orchestra, mixed choir, jazz ensemble, guitar ensemble (now in its second year) and modern band (new this year). Students were chosen through an audition process.

Selected students rehearsed a challenging repertoire in preparation for performing under the direction of six of the most prominent conductors in the United States. All conductors have received top honors in their field and spent several days rehearsing with students before the concert.

“This is an awesome accomplishment,” shared Michael Smith, Ed.S., Orchestra Director, Perrysburg Schools. “The hard work and talent that Tony put into this audition was quite inspiring. We are very proud of him!”

Last chance to see Noises Off TODAY at PHS at 2:30 p.m.!

It's a play within a play featuring actors rehearsing a flop called “Nothing’s On.” Baffled by entrances and exits, missed cues, missed lines and bothersome props, cast members drive Lloyd, their director, into a seething rage and back several times during the run.

Presented from both audience and backstage viewpoints, watch the “performance” near the end of its 10-week run as time goes by and things deteriorate until pandemonium ensues and axe-wielding co-stars and misplaced sardines take center stage during a disaster of a performance, threatening to jinx the old saying: “The show must go on.” Noises Off never fails to entertain and PHS never fails to deliver an amazing performance.

The 2019-2020 Mock Trial season began with the Perrysburg High School Mock Trial Club electing their Officers! The Club met recently and chose Senior Olivia Thomas as president; Senior Katie McGivern as vice-president; Junior Mia Wegener as corresponding secretary; Junior Evan Leong as recording secretary; Senior Thomas Clark Phelps as historian and Junior Jerrick Ban as treasurer.

Other members of the mock trial teams are: Ysabella Aromas, Jordan Barnes, Ryan Bisnett, Andy Chang, Isabella Delgado, Aditya Gupta, Tiffany Kapp, Jack Lamberger, Nikhil Methi, Daniel Mills, Michael Rausch, Srivatsav Vuppala, Avery Thompson, Jack Thompson and Tom Van Camp.

This will be the 19th year that PHS has fielded a team to compete statewide in the largest academic competition among Ohio High School students. Students learn first-hand about the law, court procedures and the judicial system while also building critical 21st Century skills.

(L to R) Jerrick Ban,Thomas Clark-Phelps, Olivia Thomas, Mia Wegener, Katie McGivern and Evan Leong
